commented_code:
discourse_reactions_desaturated_reaction_panel: "Reduces visual noise of reactions by displaying them desaturated until hover."
     discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like: "Reactions that do not count as a Like. Any reactions that are not on this list will count as a Like for badges, reporting, and other purposes."
     discourse_reactions_like_sync_enabled: "If this is enabled, historical reactions will have their matching Like records created, except those reactions defined in `discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like`. This sync will happen on a regular basis in the background, and also when you change `discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like`."
+    discourse_reactions_allow_choose_more: "If this is enabled, will add a button to allow user select any emoji in reactions picker."

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ en:
     discourse_reactions_desaturated_reaction_panel: "Reduces visual noise of reactions by displaying them desaturated until hover."
     discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like: "Reactions that do not count as a Like. Any reactions that are not on this list will count as a Like for badges, reporting, and other purposes."
     discourse_reactions_like_sync_enabled: "If this is enabled, historical reactions will have their matching Like records created, except those reactions defined in `discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like`. This sync will happen on a regular basis in the background, and also when you change `discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like`."
+    discourse_reactions_allow_choose_more: "If this is enabled, will add a button to allow user select any emoji in reactions picker."
discussion_comments.comment_body: We should also note here that `discourse_reactions_enabled_reactions` is no longer used when this is enabled.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ en:
     discourse_reactions_desaturated_reaction_panel: "Reduces visual noise of reactions by displaying them desaturated until hover."
     discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like: "Reactions that do not count as a Like. Any reactions that are not on this list will count as a Like for badges, reporting, and other purposes."
     discourse_reactions_like_sync_enabled: "If this is enabled, historical reactions will have their matching Like records created, except those reactions defined in `discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like`. This sync will happen on a regular basis in the background, and also when you change `discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like`."
+    discourse_reactions_allow_choose_more: "If this is enabled, will add a button to allow user select any emoji in reactions picker."
discussion_comments.comment_body: Also will confirm with product team internally.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ en:
     discourse_reactions_desaturated_reaction_panel: "Reduces visual noise of reactions by displaying them desaturated until hover."
     discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like: "Reactions that do not count as a Like. Any reactions that are not on this list will count as a Like for badges, reporting, and other purposes."
     discourse_reactions_like_sync_enabled: "If this is enabled, historical reactions will have their matching Like records created, except those reactions defined in `discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like`. This sync will happen on a regular basis in the background, and also when you change `discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like`."
+    discourse_reactions_allow_choose_more: "If this is enabled, will add a button to allow user select any emoji in reactions picker."
discussion_comments.comment_body: Even when `discourse_reactions_allow_choose_more` is enabled, `discourse_reactions_enabled_reactions` is used in the reactions picker popup.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ en:
     discourse_reactions_desaturated_reaction_panel: "Reduces visual noise of reactions by displaying them desaturated until hover."
     discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like: "Reactions that do not count as a Like. Any reactions that are not on this list will count as a Like for badges, reporting, and other purposes."
     discourse_reactions_like_sync_enabled: "If this is enabled, historical reactions will have their matching Like records created, except those reactions defined in `discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like`. This sync will happen on a regular basis in the background, and also when you change `discourse_reactions_excluded_from_like`."
+    discourse_reactions_allow_choose_more: "If this is enabled, will add a button to allow user select any emoji in reactions picker."
discussion_comments.comment_body: Ah yes I see; IMO it's still a bit misleading though without extra explanation for admins...hold tight on this though still discussing internally

commented_code:
default: true
     client: true
     hidden: true
+  video_conversion_enabled:
+    default: false
+  video_conversion_service:

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -2237,6 +2237,16 @@ files:
     default: true
     client: true
     hidden: true
+  video_conversion_enabled:
+    default: false
+  video_conversion_service:
discussion_comments.comment_body:
IMO this should be a `enum` type setting, with only a single option of `aws_mediaconvert`:

https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/3f666262cda2c269b11aa846d5cf7bdd453274ec/config/site_settings.yml#L207-L213

I think we should unhide it as well, since the mediaconvert role ARN one is unhidden.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -2237,6 +2237,16 @@ files:
     default: true
     client: true
     hidden: true
+  video_conversion_enabled:
+    default: false
+  video_conversion_service:
discussion_comments.comment_body: Sure easy enough, I was actually punting this work to whoever was going to add the next video conversion service.

commented_code:
default: true
     client: true
     hidden: true
+  video_conversion_enabled:

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -2237,6 +2237,16 @@ files:
     default: true
     client: true
     hidden: true
+  video_conversion_enabled:
discussion_comments.comment_body:
We need some site setting validation for this.

If it is set to true, and `video_conversion_service` is `aws_mediaconvert`, and `mediaconvert_role_arn` is blank, we should show an error.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -2237,6 +2237,16 @@ files:
     default: true
     client: true
     hidden: true
+  video_conversion_enabled:
discussion_comments.comment_body: Oh also needs to validate that S3 access key and secret key are present
